intro: Alpinia breviligulata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved ginger, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes other gingers and aromatic plants. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, pale yellow flowers arranged in inflorescences. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates with high humidity and well-drained soil. Alpinia breviligulata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and mild aromatic properties.
